byline.original: By BEN PROTESS and PETER EAVIS

abstract: Federal judge approves unusual resolution in case brought by Securities and Exchange Commission against former Freddie Mac executives, under which all parties agree to forgo further litigation; deal will yield modest payments to Freddie Mac investors and impose limited restrictions on former executives Richard F Syron, Patricia L Cook and Donald J Bisenius; marks underwhelming close to case many hoped would bring public catharsis in wake of financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: A judge approved an unusual resolution to the federal case against the mortgage giant, with the S.E.C. and Freddie Mac agreeing “no party is the prevailing party.”

headline.main: Ex-Freddie Mac Leaders Reach Deal With S.E.C.
headline.print_headline: Ex-Freddie Mac Leaders Reach Deal With S.E.C.

snippet: A judge approved an unusual resolution to the federal case against the mortgage giant, with the S.E.C. and Freddie Mac agreeing “no party is the prevailing party.”

keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
